snippet: Two years after Syria agreed to dismantle its chemical weapons stockpile, there is mounting evidence that it is using jerry-built chlorine bombs.
abstract: Relief workers report Syria is flouting international law by dropping barrel bombs filled with chlorine on residents in Sarmeen, Qminas and other insurgent held areas; chlorine is not banned under international law, is deadly only in concentrated doses and dissipates quickly, making it more an instrument of terror than death and frustrating efforts to gather evidence and prove who is dropping the bombs.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Maher Samaan and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Two years after Syria agreed to dismantle its chemical weapons stockpile, there is mounting evidence that it is using jerry-built chlorine bombs.

headline.main: Syria Is Using Chemical Weapons Again, Rescue Workers Say
headline.print_headline: Syria Is Again Using Chemical Weapons, Relief Workers Say
